summary: This bill, the "Undertaking Negotiations on Investment and Trade for Economic Dynamism Act" (UNITED Act), grants the President authority to negotiate a comprehensive trade agreement with the United Kingdom. It emphasizes the importance of open trade with allies to strengthen the U.S. economy and sets guidelines for negotiations, including honoring the Good Friday Agreement and aligning with USMCA standards. The bill outlines consultation with Congress, deadlines, and implementing procedures, while also incorporating requirements from the Bipartisan Congressional Trade Priorities and Accountability Act of 2015.
